instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Board came in first not seen power, changed both usb controllers, now it gives 20a and 100-300v but no image on screen. where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
"it gives 20a and 100-300v"
I'm very sure is not true.
Please, learn how to read the USB-C multimeter.

Did you check external video and USB activity?
CPU core voltage comes on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Same issue, as above. I have caps lock and the backlight lights up, I here the chime and there is CPU core voltas first 0,825v the 0,625v. But no display internal or external... Please advise

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Did you check external video disconnecting internal LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Sorry easy fix, internal LCD was not working! Tested with another LCD and all is ok...
